tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE network_performance_metrics (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE,
    network_name VARCHAR(50),
    latency_ms INT,
    bandwidth_mbps FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE capacity_planning (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    server_name VARCHAR(50),
    capacity_used FLOAT,
    capacity_threshold FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE network_performance_data (
    timestamp TIMESTAMP PRIMARY KEY,
    latency FLOAT,
    bandwidth FLOAT,
    packet_loss FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE site_metrics (
    site_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    site_name VARCHAR(255),
    location VARCHAR(255),
    last_update TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE capacity_planning (
    planning_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    site_id INT,
    expected_bandwidth FLOAT,
    projected_latency FLOAT,
    request_timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE network_performance_metrics (
    metric_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    metric_name VARCHAR(50),
    metric_value FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE network_devices (
    device_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(100),
    device_type VARCHAR(50),
    location VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE network_traffic (
    traffic_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    source_device_id UUID,
    destination_device_id UUID,
    traffic_volume BIGINT
)

CREATE TABLE network_capacity (
    capacity_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    server_id UUID,
    capacity_value FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE network_metrics (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  server_name VARCHAR(50),
  latency_ms FLOAT,
  throughput_mbps FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE network_reports (
  report_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  report_type VARCHAR(20),
  analyst VARCHAR(50),
  findings TEXT
);
